headline.main: Nuns Offer Clues to Alzheimer's and Aging

docs.abstract: Fifteen-year study of elderly Catholic nuns at convents around nation is considered to be one of most innovative efforts to answer questions about who gets Alzheimer's disease and why; Dr David A Snowdon, epidemiologist, and colleagues have studied 678 nuns; their research shows that folic acid may help stave off Alzheimer's disease; that small, barely perceptible strokes may trigger some dementia; and, most striking, that early language ability may be linked to lower risk of Alzheimer's; his report, published in The Journal of Personality and Social Psychology, says nuns who express more positive emotions live significantly longer than those expressing fewer positive emotions; study is considered powerful because it has information from several stages in its subjects' lives, including when they were too young to manifest Alzheimer's or other diseases related to aging; photos (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: A spiraling road slopes gently up to Good Counsel Hill, where the convent of the School Sisters of Notre Dame perches peacefully. Within its thick red brick walls are bright paintings of nuns and children. Organ hymns waft from a circular chapel, and nuns attend Mass and murmur rosaries under a white vaulted dome. But this crucible of faith is also the site of an extraordinary scientific experiment. For 15 years, elderly Catholic nuns here have had their genes analyzed and balance and strength measured. They have been tested on how many words they can remember minutes after reading them on flashcards, how many animals they can name in a minute and whether they can count coins correctly.

docs.abstract: In this lesson, students estimate the amount of money a non-smoking teen spends in a week, a month, and a year, and compare it with the expenses of a teen who smokes one, two, and three packs a day. They then research other reasons that teens should not smoke, and create an ad campaign geared toward young people emphasizing the financial and health benefits of not smoking.
